en:
Ionic column; Peitho (labelled to the right of her head), standing 3/4-view to the right, her weight on her left leg, her right leg relaxed, wearing a peplos belted over a long overfold, holds her right arm at her side, and holds a footed chest, with three balls atop, and a sash, in her left arm; Aphrodite (labelled), seated on a klismos 3/4-view to the left, with her legs crossed, wearing a himation around her legs, over a belted, medium-sleeved chiton with shoulder straps, a rayed sphendone, two bands on each wrist, and a dotted disk earring, rests her left arm on the back of her chair, and holds her right hand in front of her chest, in a speaking gesture; a kalathos basket; Hygieia (labelled above her head), standing 3/4-view to the left, with her weight on her right leg, her left leg relaxed, wearing a peplos, belted over a long overfold, holds a plemmochoe to the left, in her right hand, and a footed chest in her left hand; Eudaimonia (labelled), standing near frontal, slightly to the right, with her head profile to the right, her weight on her left leg, her right leg relaxed, wearing a himation draped over her left shoulder, around her lower body, and back over her bent left arm, over a short-sleeved chiton with shoulder straps, and a high pony tail, holds an eight-bead necklace down to the left, in her right hand, and holds her left hand, palm up (in a speaking gesture?), to the right; Paidia (labelled above her head), running 3/4-view to the left, with her weight on her forward, bent, right leg, wearing a sleeveless, belted chiton with a kolpos and shoulder straps, and loose, windswept hair, balances a stick on her outstretched right hand, and holds her left hand up behind her head; Eukleia (labelled above her head), standing 3/4-view to the right, with her weight on her left leg, her right leg relaxed, wearing a belted peplos and a sphendone, holds her right arm at her side, and holds a round (?) wicker basket and a sash in her left arm; Eunomia (labelled vertically, down the right side of her body), standing 3/4-view to the left, with weight on her right leg, her left leg relaxed, wearing a himation draped around her lower body and over her left arm (obscuring it), over a belted, medium-sleeved chiton, a broad taenia, and disk earrings, points the index finger of her right hand down to the left.

The long-standing misreading of "Eunomia" as "Aponia" has recently been corrected, and confirmed by Richard Stone, Conservator at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, at the instigation of Gloria Ferrari (see bibliography below).

G. Ferrari, "The End of Aponia," <hi rend="ital">MMJ</hi> 30 (1995)
      17-18; <bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 32, 66, 78, 129, 181, 203, 230 no. 1, figs. 1,
      83, 141, 162; <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.141 s.v. Paidia no. 4, pl. 94 (A.
      Kossatz-Deissmann), 246 s.v. Peitho no. 29 (N. Icard-Gianolio); <bibl>Burn
      1987</bibl>, 117 MM 143; <bibl>Add2</bibl>, 364-65;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.47 s.v. Eudaimonia 1 no. 6, pl. 22 (H.A. Shapiro), 50 s.v.
      Eukleia no. 6 (A. Kossatz-Deissmann); H.A. Shapiro, ""Ponos and Aponia,"" GRBS 25 (1984)
      107-10, pl. 1; <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 2.121 s.v. Aphrodite no. 1263 (A. Delivorrias),
      465 s.v. Aponia no. 1, pl. 354 (H.A. Shapiro); <bibl>Neils 1983</bibl>, 282 fig.
      18; <bibl>Para</bibl>, 479; <bibl>Hamdorf 1964</bibl> 112 no. 447a;
      <bibl>Hibbs 1961</bibl> 74, fig. 88; <bibl>Papadaki 1960</bibl> 117;
      <bibl>Hampe 1955</bibl>, 119c; <bibl>Mtzger 1951</bibl>, 18-19; J.D.
      Beazley, "Some Inscriptions on Vases," <hi rend="ital">AJA</hi> 54 (1950) 320;
      <bibl>Richter & Hall 1936</bibl>, 202-203 no. 161, pls. 159, 178 (with
      previous bibliography); E. Zevi, <hi rend="ital">Scene di gineceo. MemLinc</hi> 6
      ser. 6 (1938) 334-35; <bibl>Richter & Milne 1935, 30.1</bibl>; G.M.A. Richter,
      "Department of Classical Art. The Accessions of 1909," <hi rend="ital">BMMA</hi> 5
      (1910) 145, fig. 7.
